node.display_long_description:
CLOSE COMBAT: THE MOST REVOLUTIONARY VERSION SINCE THE GAME’S RELEASE.

The Horizon scientific research laboratory is a deceptively quiet place. When you came round, there were hundreds of the living dead all around you. All because of that damn T12 virus.

To survive and save the world from the virus, use both hands and your head: never stop shooting, pick up rounds, climb up pipes and ladders, jump onto bars and grab hold of ropes, search cupboards and throw everything you find at the zombies.

You’re free to choose whatever weapons and tactics you want. Prove your agility, imagination and accuracy.

The denizens of the Horizon station will punish you for one thing: hesitation...

* FEATURES *

●  Realistic bloody graphics in the spirit of zombie apocalypse films.
●  Use two controllers actively: fire with both hands, fire as you hang on a rope, reload your shotgun with your second hand, grab onto pipes and explore hard-to-reach areas of the station.

latest_supported_binary.change_log:
Version: 0.9.25.8

- Decreased frequency of zombies falling through the floor or sticking in the game geometry
- Also decreased the frequency of zombies becoming invisible
- Fixed a number of other bugs

If you find a bug, or if you have any suggestions for game improvement, please write us at info@dream-dev.com.

Thank you very much.

We are hard at work on the next major updates, including horde mode, the next chapter, and several more unannounced updates.

nodes.title: CLOSE COMBAT: THE MOST REVOLUTIONARY VERSION SINCE THE GAME’S RELEASE.
nodes.body_text:
The brand-new Close Combat version features new and improved weapons, greater combat versatility, and improved visuals.

Upgrades include:

- We’ve added 15+ melee weapons – pipes, bats, hammers, rebar, and more.
- Melee weapons are divided into categories and differentiated not only visually, but also by weight, ease of use, damage, and other factors.
- Hold the weapon where you like and how you like. Prefer a one-handed grip? Two-handed? It’s up to you! And remember – this affects your strike power and accuracy, too.
- Player interactions with enemies have been completely redesigned. The enemy now reacts not only to being shot, but also to melee weapon interactions, weapon stock interactions, and even bare-handed interactions.
- You can knock down enemies and then beat them to death.
- Enemy reaction physics have changed: all interactions with enemies now look more realistic.
- Gameplay has been completely rebalanced. You wanted more headshots; we delivered.
- We introduce a modified and improved enemy type – the Mask.
- A new attack type has been added: bite.
- Game sounds have been modified and improved.
- Visual elements associated with enemies have been improved.

nodes.title: Happy Howl-o-ween!
nodes.body_text:
The rooms and corridors of the Horizon Laboratory have changed –pumpkins and other suspicious objects have been discovered.

Your mission is to investigate it all, so that it can return to normal!

node.reviewDescription:
I love this game. it's sort of gotten me through my fear of horror games. I've only got a few problems with it. 

1. I think some zombies are just too fast. Some look like they should be really slow, but they arent.

2. I personally think the environment is too dark. if there is a way to fix that, I'd love to know.

3. I think there should be some computer puzzles, or other puzzles in general that could unlock some deep lore about what is going on.

overall, this game is amazing, and I will absolutely play it to the end

developerResponse.body:
Hey puffyshmuffy,
Thank you for your review. 
We are very glad that you liked our game. 
A special thanks for your suggestions which can help to make the game better. 
We appreciate all ideas of our players as to the game improvement and always try to take them into account when making the updates (if it’s possible). 
Currently, we’re working on two major updates – Horde Mode and the New Chapter. Hopefully, you’ll like them.
